author: Anonymous Helix
title: Review sessions before final?
question:
Hello, 
I know some of my other courses are doing review sessions as opposed to standardized office hours. Are there any TAs, or professors, that plan to work through final problems with students before the final?
If so, where can I access those zoom links?
instructor_answer:
I don’t believe that we are doing review sessions. But, if you have a problem (or more than one) you’d like to go over during office hours, we’d be happy to go over that.
What I’ve done during my office hours before is go through problems as a group, getting student’s input on where to go in the next step, and providing guidance if needed. That way students can learn from each other, go through the questions that they wanted to go through (and that other students in the OH wanted to go through) and be in a productive learning environment. If it is what students want during my OH on the 19th, I am happy to structure it that way (it does depend on the natural flow of the office hour though; no guarantees.) And, come to think of it, that’s what I found to be super helpful in my own studying for the final exam when I took the course.
So you can think of it as a “student-guided final exam review” if you’d like, but it is not a review session.
